Very good restaurant, a little pricey, but what isn’t in Paris. We ordered two menus for three people and was very good to dinner time. We ate a little bit of the best choices of the restaurant and we liked.

I think the vibe is cool. I've been here quite a few times and i wanna share with you because this place is hip and cool. Excellent roof surrounded by glasses, fabulous view, nice people here. Everything looks perfect.

Author: Stjepan Kujadin;

Really nice place in Paris to visit during your stay. Host was super nice. Cocktails were good, nothing special. Food was okay, find it a bit overpriced for the quality given. The views are beautiful and the restaurant decor is stunning. I enjoyed the music a lot

Author: Paulo GHINATO;
Rating: 5

Author: James Hughes;
Rating: 4
When: 7 months ago
Really beautiful restaurant in one of the best locations of Paris, service is friendly and efficient. Only negative, despite the food and drinks being very good, was that it is very overpriced for the quality. For what we spent on food + drinks, we could have easily eaten at a 1* Michelin restaurant. Overall, worth checking out and definitely would go back.

Author: Najla Kurbeh (Noojy);
Rating: 5

One le my all time faves in Paris! And Kenzo too is one of my all time fave designers ;) Beautiful set up, central location, great staff, you need to reserve in advance most of the time. Deco, food presentation as well as taste, lighting, view & music.

Name: Le Café Marly

[]Author: Peter Noorkoiv;

I thought the days of restaurant rip offs were over. Style over substance, terrible food at grossly inflated price. Unless you have money to throw in the Seine, don’t waste your time.

Author: Regan Boord;

Rating: 3
When: a year ago
So we were there just after new year around 4 pm or so. It is a very cute place and very stylish look about it but there was no atmosphere. There was one guy behind the bar which was chatting to the french guests and the other side of the bar was left without taking an order we waited 15 minutes and then we left as we felt we were being ignored.not sure if in the evening it is better with better service or more buzz but it was disappointing. Probably still worth to have a peak inside just to see but maybe evening is better!

Author: Sabrina H;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
On a Saturday evening, we went in the basement of Harry’s New York Bar, where attentive waitresses and waiters serve a variety of fine gin, vodka and whiskey. The ambience is intimate and classy. Vivid conversations are damned by the lofty Bordeaux red cushions. For the musical ear, a pianist skilfully unites jazz and classics. If you feel like dancing thereafter, just visit the bar next door where live music is played and a vibrant crowd of locals, expats and some tourists hit the dance floor and enjoy a good night out together 💃🏼🕺🏻👯‍♂️🧍🏼‍♂️!

Author: Johanna Schlurmann;

Like a throw back in time. Great location for good food and for little party upstairs as well. Big variety of dishes: starters, main courses & desserts. Very tasty!

Author: Shaheryar Mian;
Rating: 5

Author: Thomas Hyatt;

Author: Mark Warne-Smith;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Very very frosty venue, worth every euro for both food and service. Scallops were in the best ever range, the cocktail, named after Madame Claude, was quite possibly the best I ever had, and at least in the last 10 years. Full of beautiful people and masters of the universe, but yet for some strange reason didn't have the haughtiness that you would find in an equivalent NY bar, there was something human at the same time about the place that made it even more enjoyable. Love Paris.

Name: Le Caveau de la Huchette
Last 5 Reviews:
[]Author: Adam Carlson;
Rating: 5
When: a week ago
By far my favorite jazz spot in Paris. Old school 1950’s Blue Note / Prestige, Riverside jazz era vibe / mood. Great wine selection . Incomparable ambiance. Cannot wait for it to reopen!!

Author: Thomas Brittain;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
One of my favorite places to visit in Paris. Unbelievable friendly and upbeat atmosphere. Small cover charge to enter but do not let that discourage you. Look this place up online first to see who is playing what night, but honestly I’ve never been to a bad show here. All of their musicians are fantastic. On your next trip to Paris make this a stop, it will end up being one of the highlights of your trip. Remember to show up when the doors open so that you can ensure you get a good seat.

Author: Hailey Frazier;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
A hidden Jazz Gem! My husband and I had the most charming date night EVER here! The live underground swing band was amazing and we danced the night away!! It’s located in a great spot so you can easily grab food before or after going dancing! There was a decent sized crowd, small enough to still feel intimate but large enough to have a blast! We will be visiting again, on our next trip!!

Author: Dev;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Absolutely memorable night of fantastic music and dancing, and watching all the couples dance to jazz was truly a night to remember! Couldn’t stop smiling and grooving to the really catchy music the whole time! Drinks a bit pricy, but would definitely go back there every single time I’m in Paris!

Author: Viola H;

Name: Saint James Albany Paris Hôtel Spa
Last 5 Reviews:
[]Author: Jonathan Schnaittacher;
Rating: 5
When: 4 months ago
The location is great, as it is situated right next to the Louvre and other sights. The staff is very nice and the service is great, as well as the food that can be delivered to your room. Overall a great place if you are planning to stay in Paris over night.

Author: Charlie Roy;
Rating: 4
When: 2 months ago
It seems they have closed, perhaps permanently. 6th time back to St. James & Albany. Over past 20 years it's been refurbished quit a bit. Mostly good smart changes. One of the few hotels with a grand piano available, although currently lacking a bench. I've heard guests playing Chopin & Rachmaninov pretty well here. Fairly good breakfasts, good bar after 4 PM. On warm days try meals in their courtyard. Very clean, but still showing signs of wear and age. Rooms on courtyards are very quiet. One of the best locations in all of Paris right on Rue de Rivoli across from the Tuileries. Walk to metro station across street. Multiple great restaurants within 5-10 minute walk. Very nice staff. Helpful.

Author: Kevin DVSteentje;
Rating: 5

Excellent Hotel, with 5 star service!! Top location in the center and very close to the metro. Very good for business or weekend in Paris

Author: Jackie Schwarzinger;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
fantastic location, excellent and friendly staff, relaxing pool area for a swim in between sightseeing. room was clean, bed was comfortable and all together for Paris standards spacious and well equipped. negative: the room is quite dark (I didn't mind, I'd rather have a dark room than noisy street) and the walls are very thin. you can hear people walking down the hall, talking in other rooms etc. nonetheless I'd book again!

Author: Manuela Llaneza;

Author: Roberto Rupcich;
Rating: 4
When: a year ago
Great time watching live Jazz with some very talented musicians! Above what I was expecting. The show is in a smaller room upstairs where they cram quite a bit of people. Fortunately, they don’t let people smoke up there. Chairs are not very comfortable. Drinks are good and prices are 10-14€ per drink. Go before the live shows and happy hour downstairs is fun with cheaper drinks. Server was very friendly although a little slow since he was the only one upstairs attending to the live music room. My wife and I had a great experience here but it was certainly due to the music. Go check it out! They seems to hire very talented artists! Very impressed!

Rating: 1
When: a year ago
We checked in and were awoken the next morning by the sounds of construction downstairs. We were not informed on check in that there would be construction in the lobby the week we were there, this seems pertinent as our room was above the lobby. I was told the noise would only be for one day, however each day we were there, there was construction. I was told each day by the front of house that it was the last day and that the next day it would be quiet. Additionally directly next door they were doing construction, and the manager tried to blame it on them saying the noise was coming from across the street, even though we could feel the floor shaking. They offered to move us to a different room, but each day I was told the noise would stop so I decided against the inconvenience. I had to ARGUE with the manager Alexi and was RUDELY INTERRUPTED multiple times. They claim to be a four star hotel but are closer to a airport motel. Terrible customer service. I was told I would get a refund and still haven't received it.

Author: Hiro;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Very good hotel, the room was nice.

Name: Ô Chateau
Last 5 Reviews:
[]Author: K P.;
Rating: 5
When: a year ago
Accidentally stopped by because all other places are full/ super long line, this place has no line but end up being one of my very best night in Paris The good: food is tasty, wine is delicious (Alsace white 2016), both waitresses are genuinely sweet and lovely, the chair is comfortable, deco is comfy, price is good The bad: the genre of the music is very inconsistent, when you are about to get into the soul vibe then suddenly the next song is some loud hip hop, happened several times but because everything else was so great i still rate a 5 stars. Will definitely come back again !
